TopicTitle: procedural fuel tanks and rockets no longer bending as much

Articles.Content: so. in a lot of the gameplay videos in ksp 2 we see bosters almost hanging lose and super easily falling off. this is probably just demonsration and not how it will actually be.  however in those same videos the main rocket barely bends like they where one giant part. we have also seen procedural wings in ksp2. therefore i think it is likely we will have procedural fuel tanks at least in ksp2. what  i mean with this is basically that you would just have one fuel tank and you can just choose the length of it.
yeah this could be great for structural integrity and awsome from a game performance standpoint, but maybe not from a game play design standpoint.

While it would be a good idea, I think the KSP 2 team is past that part of development. From screenshots of the KSP 2 VAB, it looks like we will have non-procedural tanks. Maybe once procedural tank mods come out, you can download them.
